subject: Re: [junit] Re:How to use JUnit return String[]
msgSnippet: ... I think you want to use assertEquals() with arrays. If that is true, then use JUnit-addons, which provides the class ArrayAssert with methods for comparing
messageBody:
kavitha arumugam wrote:

> Hi All,
>
> I have came cross simple problem.
> How to return String array in Junit. If u are
> returning String is working. But i have no idea String
> [].
>
>
> Java Code:
> public String[] getMandatoryParameters(){
> return new String[]{"SourceString"};
> }
>
> JUnit code: here testclass calling java class already
> initialized in setup
> public void testgetMandatoryParameters()
> {
> String getMandatoryParam = {"SourceString"};
> assertEquals( testClass.getMandatoryParameters ),
> getMandatoryParam);
> }
>
> I will appreciate ur help.

I think you want to use assertEquals() with arrays. If that is true,
then use JUnit-addons, which provides the class ArrayAssert with methods
for comparing arrays.
--
